page.title: 13 THE ROADS OF SHALDON
page.content: The roads in Shaldon used to be just dirt tracks until they were Mac- adarnized from 1910-1920. Today traffic between Shaldon and Torquay travels a- long the New Torquay Road. In the past horses and carts had to travel along the Old Torquay Road which is very steep and narrow and is now in a bad condition. At one point a lane leads off it and branches into 2 lanes - Milan Lane and Butterfly Lane. Butter- fly Lane is in a better condition than Milan Lane but neither is in a very good condition. Other lanes in the area include Brook Lane, Lambert Lane and Laurel Lane, the latter is known locally as "The Big Dipper". Thin winding lanes are typical of the area and when the tide is high the lower lanes are often fooded.
